availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Jewell (Green County, Kentucky, laborer, farmer, and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, laborer, farmer, and soldier. Barren County, Kentucky, native. Married to Jemima Parker Jewell in Green County, Kentucky, on September 19, 1848. Father of Mary C. Jewell, Thomas E. Jewell, Mary E. Jewell, and Elias Jewell. Guardian of Mary J. Gum. Laborer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 30, 1861, to January 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
